page.title: 17Heathwaite Farm, Coniston
page.content: A traditional Lakeland{hill farm}of typical size. It's 35 hectares carry suckler cattle and hill sheep. Most of the farm consists of small, steep fields rising to the fell wall, the limit of enclosed farmland. The farm has{fell rights;}sheep may be grazed on the open fell. At certain times the sheep are {gathered,}with the assistance of sheep-dogs, for clipping, dipping and tupping. During the past five years the present occupier has done much to{improve}the former dilapidated state of the farm. He has re-layed overgrown hedges, repaired wall gaps, and improved much of his grazing. {FARMING PROBLEMS:}The main problems are - Dogs worrying stock, walkers leaving gates open, hard weather during lambing time, sheep ticks and other parasites.
